_source.productDescription:
For 18 years, the Asia Pacific Screen Awards has stood as the region's highest accolade in filmâ€”a glittering celebration where the most exceptional storytelling from 78 countries and areas across Asia Pacific is honoured. This isn't just an awards ceremony; it's where cinematic excellence meets cultural diversity, where groundbreaking films that reflect authentic cultural origins receive the recognition they deserve.

The magic begins with a red-carpet event filled with elegance and anticipation, flowing seamlessly into the formal ceremony in the magnificent Diamond Ballroom. From intimate character studies to epic adventures, from mind-blowing documentaries to innovative animations, each award recognises the power of storytelling that transcends borders.

Join in for the region's most prestigious celebration of cinematic excellence!

If you require specific accessibility needs for any of their events, please contact them via email. 

The Asia Pacific Screen Academy acknowledges the Traditional Custodians and Owners of Country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community.

There may be photography and recordings at APSA events for promotional purposes. Your participation in APSA events signifies your agreement to this photography and media release disclaimer.
_source.productShortDescription: Asia Pacific Screen Awards is where cinematic excellence meets cultural diversity, where groundbreaking films that reflect authentic cultural origins receive the recognition they deserve.

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Offer multiple options for booking - web, email, phone
Offer a range of contact methods for receiving complaints
Ask all visitors if there are any specific needs to be met
Website meets WCAG 2.0 accessibility standards
Advise tour guides of the access needs of guests at the time of booking (includes pick up and drop off requirements)
Provide assistance with booking arrangements (includes providing clear  itineraries with written instructions  on what to do at various destinations)

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Use Plain English / easy read signage and information (includes menus and emergency information)

attributeBlocks.attributeSubType2IdDescription: Caters for people who are blind or have vision loss.

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Have  Braille and tactile signage on all information and paths of travel
Provide digital communication materials (hard copy information is also available on line)
Have raised tactile buttons in your lifts
Have handrails on all your stairways

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Have visual alerts for emergencies (Include flashing light)

attributeBlocks.attributeSubType2IdDescription: Caters for people with sufficient mobility to climb a few steps but who would benefit from fixtures to aid balance. (This includes people using walking frames and mobility aids)

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Use floors/coverings which are slip resistant, firm and smooth

attributeBlocks.attributeSubType2IdDescription: Caters for people who use a wheelchair.

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Have step free outdoor pathways (includes picnic areas, barbecues and shelters)
Have step free access to restaurant, lounge and bar
Have an accessible public toilet which is unlocked
Have at least one wheelchair accessible parking space with wheelchair accessible signage clearly displayed (International standards are 3200mm wide x 2500 mm high)

attributeBlocks.attributeSubType2IdDescription: Caters for people with allergies and intolerances.

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Modify your cooking and cleaning practices to cater for people with food allergies or chemical intolerances (could include menus with meals free from: nuts, dairy, seafood, eggs, gluten etc)

productComments.commentText:
For 18 years, the Asia Pacific Screen Awards has stood as the region's highest accolade in filmâ€”a glittering celebration where the most exceptional storytelling from 78 countries and areas across Asia Pacific is honoured. This isn't just an awards ceremony; it's where cinematic excellence meets cultural diversity, where groundbreaking films that reflect authentic cultural origins receive the recognition they deserve.

The magic begins with a red-carpet event filled with elegance and anticipation, flowing seamlessly into the formal ceremony in the magnificent Diamond Ballroom. From intimate character studies to epic adventures, from mind-blowing documentaries to innovative animations, each award recognises the power of storytelling that transcends borders.

Join in for the region's most prestigious celebration of cinematic excellence!

If you require specific accessibility needs for any of their events, please contact them via email. 

The Asia Pacific Screen Academy acknowledges the Traditional Custodians and Owners of Country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community.

There may be photography and recordings at APSA events for promotional purposes. Your participation in APSA events signifies your agreement to this photography and media release disclaimer.

Selama 18 tahun, Asia Pacific Screen Awards telah menjadi penghargaan tertinggi di bidang perfilman di kawasan iniâ€”sebuah perayaan gemerlap yang mengapresiasi penceritaan paling luar biasa dari 78 negara dan kawasan di Asia Pasifik. Ini bukan sekadar upacara penghargaan; ini adalah tempat di mana keunggulan sinematik bertemu dengan keragaman budaya, di mana film-film inovatif yang mencerminkan asal-usul budaya autentik menerima pengakuan yang layak mereka dapatkan.

Keajaiban dimulai dengan acara karpet merah yang penuh keanggunan dan antisipasi, mengalir mulus ke upacara formal di Diamond Ballroom yang megah. Dari studi karakter yang intim hingga petualangan epik, dari dokumenter yang memukau hingga animasi inovatif, setiap penghargaan mengakui kekuatan penceritaan yang melampaui batas.

Bergabunglah dalam perayaan keunggulan sinematik paling bergengsi di kawasan ini!

Jika Anda memerlukan kebutuhan aksesibilitas khusus untuk acara mereka, silakan hubungi mereka melalui email.

Asia Pacific Screen Academy memberikan penghargaan kepada para Penjaga dan Pemilik Adat di seluruh Australia dan hubungan mereka dengan daratan, lautan, dan komunitas.

Mungkin ada fotografi dan rekaman di acara APSA untuk tujuan promosi. Partisipasi Anda dalam acara APSA menandakan persetujuan Anda terhadap pernyataan penyangkalan terkait fotografi dan rilis media ini.

_source.productDescription:
Thanksgiving is a wonderful time to come together to consider all we are grateful for!

Gather with family and friends and enjoy an evening of warmth and tradition as Lennons presents a refined Thanksgiving dinner.

Indulge in a two-course menu inspired by the season, while the smooth sounds of live jazz set the mood. Served in our classic bistro setting, it's a feast that honours tradition with an elevated Lennons touch.
_source.productShortDescription: Thanksgiving is a wonderful time to come together to consider all we are grateful for!

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Offer multiple options for booking - web, email, phone
Offer a range of contact methods for receiving complaints
Employ people with disability
Train your staff in disability awareness
Have accessibility information and photos, including of a bathroom, room and/or floor plan on your website (can be emailed on request)
Ask all visitors if there are any specific needs to be met
Website meets WCAG 2.0 accessibility standards
Advise tour guides of the access needs of guests at the time of booking (includes pick up and drop off requirements)
Provide assistance with booking arrangements (includes providing clear  itineraries with written instructions  on what to do at various destinations)

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Have  Braille and tactile signage on all information and paths of travel
Provide information in large print
Provide digital communication materials (hard copy information is also available on line)
Use easy read fonts in your signage and communication materials (Helvetica and Arial)
Train your staff  in customer service for people with vision loss (training would incorporate way finding and communicating with people with vision loss)
Have handrails on all your stairways
Have Exit signs which are visible at a ground level (high level signs are difficult to see in a fire)

attributeBlocks.attributeSubType2IdDescription: Caters for people who are deaf or have hearing loss.

attributes.attributeIdDescription: Have step free access to restaurant, lounge and bar
Have step free access to the conference or function room
Have lifts with enough space for people using a mobility aid to enter and turn around to use the lift buttons. Buttons are at accessible height.
Have doorways which are easy to open and have lever handles (doorways 850mm or wider when open and not heavy)
Have an accessible public toilet which is unlocked
Have a wheelchair accessible toilet / shower and change room
Provide valet parking

attributeBlocks.attributeSubType2IdDescription: Caters for people with high support needs who travel with a support person.

_source.productName: Kenny Rogers and Friends Tribute Show - Gladstone!
_source.productDescription:
Graham G Toole pays tribute to superstars Kenny Rogers, Glen Campbell and John Denver.

Performing songs such as Lady, The Gambler, Rhinestone Cowboy, Thank God I'm A Country Boy, Country Roads and many more, choosing a favourite will be incredibly hard. Folks from the era who are eager to share the music they grew up with can join Graham as he performs these well-crafted classics that transcends through the ages.

Watch Graham and his six-piece band as they take you on a journey through the golden years. Sway to the ebb and flow of these popular hits, where a line in a song can take you back to a special time in your life.

_source.productName: Santa and Sirens - Christmas in Ipswich
_source.productDescription:
Where holiday magic meets real-life heroes! This is your chance to meet Santa and friends amidst a variety of emergency service vehicles decorated in festive cheer.

Capture the moment with photos and embrace the joy of the season with a nod to those who serve and protect.

You'll also be entertained by Journey Church as they present a live carols performance.

Plus, complete the magical evening by experiencing the Official Lighting of the City Christmas Tree in d'Arcy Doyle Place from 6.45 pm.
